data.title: RIP Mr. Funnyman, Robin Williams.
data.meta_description: RIP Mr. Funnyman, Robin Williams. Thank you for inspiring us and making us laugh through the years. Mrs. Doubtfire will always be in my top favorites ♥.   This photo was taken just over the weekend while visiting Madame Tussaud's Wax Museum in Hollywood. I wish I had the chance to meet him in person…
data.text:
Thank you for inspiring us and making us laugh through the years.

Mrs. Doubtfire will always be in my top favorites ♥.

This photo was taken just over the weekend while visiting Madame Tussaud’s Wax Museum in Hollywood.

I wish I had the chance to meet him in person as I’ve been a fan for many years and was always amazed at how talented he was.

The movie Mrs. Doubtfire is very special to me as my father who I did not grew up with and did not meet until I was 13 years old sent me a VHS tape of the movie as a gift. I can’t count on my fingers how many times I’ve watched the movie and it never fails to make me laugh to this day. I was so excited when I heard about a possible sequel a few months ago and that Sally Field is interested to reprise her role as Miranda Hillard but with Robin Williams’s untimely passing, I don’t think that’s even possible now as I don’t think anyone can portray the character of Mrs. Doubtfire any better than he did. That role fit him like a glove!

It’s a big loss for the entertainment industry but more so for his family.

I pray that they will all find peace and solace during this difficult time in the wonderful memories they had with their loved one. ♥
